result.execSummary:
The defendant Sadiq Imani was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sadiq Imani is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sadiq Imani was found guilty of Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Sadiq Imani was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $38,544.21 to be paid to TCF Bank.

Pay mandatory DNA surcharge on count one, surcharge waived on count three as it has already been ordered on count one.
BOTH COUNTS:  pay all court costs, surcharges. 
AS TO RESTITUTON/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  to be paid out of up to 25% prison funds. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to count three, but consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 588 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.  NO contact with drug community.
No  contact with victim Kristine K. and TCF Bank at the N. 76 Street location.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 588 days.
**Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 19 years Initial Confinement in this case.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sadiq Imani in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Sadiq Imani in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  Additional statement by Jane R.  

COUNTS 1 AND 3 ARE CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER BUT CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 30 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 20 years with credit for 588 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 10 years.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 588 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge on Count 3, as it has already been ordered on Count 1.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Kristine K. and TCF Bank at the N. 76th Street location. 
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restititution is ordered in the amount of $38,544.21 to be paid to TCF bank.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges and restitution, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 19 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.   
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Sentencing hearing on August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Telephone call to Attorney Haney to discuss new sentencing dates agreed upon with ADA Robles.  Case adjourned for Sentencing hearing on August 26, 2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 26.

Defendant Sadiq Imani in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Defendant Sadiq Imani in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   On the same day, at the hour of 11:29 a.m., the jury returned and by their foreperson, Richard M, brought in a verdict as follows:

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Sadiq Imani, GUILTY of Armed Robbery by use of force, as a party to a crime, as charged, in the Information.  Dated this 19th day of June, 2015.  Richard M., Foreperson."
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Sadiq Imani, GUILTY of False Imprisonment, as a party to a crime, as charged, in the Information.  Dated this 19th day of June, 2015.  Richard M., Foreperson."

The Court polled the Jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Jury verdict received and filed.  Jury discharged.
The Court denied the defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.
The Court granted the State's motion for judgment on the verdict and ordered that a judgment of conviction be entered on the record.  PSI was ordered. Defendant was REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing on July 23, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.
State's Exhibit list filed.
